item.title: Ticket #7803 (New Setting in Admin Section for Header/Footer Snippets) created
item.dc:creator: cpoteet
item.description:
I've been working with Grafitti CMS recently (fantastic), and they have a textbox for non-coding admins to add snippets to the header/footer for things such as Google Analytics code, etc.

It would be super easy to add an option box and hook into the header/footer actions.

Thoughts?

item.title: Ticket #7800 (Theme Directory page broken) updated
item.dc:creator: DD32
item.description: The patch will hide the error, But in my mind, The problem is that its making it to that point, Knowing what the $theme is set to when it fails would be helpful. As it is, Your current theme would not be checked to see if there was an updated version available, Even if it was listed in the directory.

item.title: Ticket #7800 (Theme Directory page broken) updated
item.dc:creator: thee17
item.description: Tried the patch and it fixed the problem.

item.title: Ticket #7800 (Theme Directory page broken) updated
item.dc:creator: thee17
item.description:
My Current theme's CSS's header is as follows. I noticed from going from r8998 to r9017 did not upgrade btween them, it is happining on 2 installs that happen to use the same theme the other replaces .ca with .tv

/*

Theme Name: CEFM.ca ver 3.1 was communist

Description: 2 coloumn red web2 theme

Author: Jinsona designs

Author URI: ​http://web2feel.com/

Tags: 2 coloumn red web2 theme

*/

item.dc:creator: mrmist

invalid:

This is something you should ask on the support forums. It sounds more like you have not uploaded all the files into /wp-admin/

Try ​http://wordpress.org/support/

Closing as invalid for now.

item.title: Ticket #7800 (Theme Directory page broken) updated
item.dc:creator: DD32
item.description: That patch adds type-checking to the function as well as just checking if the element is set.

item.title: 7800.diff attached to Ticket #7800
item.dc:creator: DD32

item.title: Ticket #7800 (Theme Directory page broken) updated
item.dc:creator: DD32
item.description:
I'm suspicious as to why the error has appeared now that the theme update stuff is in; Its caused by the Theme update checkers UI not checking the type first, But the fact your current theme doesnt have a valid stylesheet name assoc. with it, seems to say there's something else at fault (perhaps in your setup).

I would add a var_dump($theme); to line #66 of wp-admin/themes.php to check that the result from current_theme_info() is correct. eg: 

	if ( !isset($themes_update) )
		$themes_update = get_option('update_themes');
var_dump($theme);
	if ( isset($theme->stylesheet) )
		$stylesheet = $theme->stylesheet;

item.title: Ticket #7802 (404 error on new WP 2.6.2 install) created
item.dc:creator: peacelamp
item.description:
Hi, I uploaded the new webpress 2.6.2 templates after. I modified text in wp-config.php as per an older wp-config.php. I can see the folder wp-admin on my cpanel but I am unable to log into www.amandeepsandhu.com/wp-admin. I get this error:

Not Found The requested URL /wp-admin was not found on this server.

Additionally, a 404 Not Found error was encountered while trying to use an ErrorDocument to handle the request.

Apache/2.0.63 (Unix) mod_ssl/2.0.63 OpenSSL/0.9.8b mod_auth_passthrough/2.1 mod_bwlimited/1.4 FrontPage/5.0.2.2635 PHP/5.2.5 Server at www.amandeepsandhu.com Port 80

Please let me know what is going wrong.

Regards, Aman

item.description: Make drafts without a title show as "(no title)" in QuickPress

item.title: Ticket #7801 (Drafts with no title are just a space in QuickPress) created
item.dc:creator: Speedboxer
item.description: In QuickPress, under Recent Drafts, any drafts without a title will just show up as a space (well, not even a space, actually). They should show up as "(no title)" like they do elsewhere.

item.title: Ticket #7798 (tag__not_in doesn't seem to work in filters) created
item.dc:creator: gmorehoudh
item.description:
I'm attempting to exclude posts with a certain tag from feeds under certain conditions. I'm using tag__not_in, but many more posts are disappearing from the feed than are tagged with the particular tag. I've double-checked the tag ID in the database and the manage tags page in the admin interface, so it's not incorrect in my code. 

function hide_noaff_posts_from_feed($post) {
	global $query_string;
	if(is_feed()) {
		$vars = parse_str($query_string);
		$vars['tag__not_in'] = array(28);	// 28 is the id of the 'noaff' tag in the terms table
		query_posts($vars);
	}
}
[...]
add_action('loop_start', 'hide_noaff_posts_from_feed');

and 

function fff($query) {
	$query->set('tag__not_in', array(28));
	return $query;
}
[...]
add_filter('pre_get_posts', 'fff');

Neither of these work properly. They exclude many posts, but I've only tagged one with the tag with id 28.
